intro: Ipomoea phyllomega, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and climbing habit. Its seeds are encased in a fleshy, orange-colored capsule that splits open when mature. Ipomoea phyllomega is often found in disturbed areas and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
